pr_title: Make `HttpData` closeable and support more `ByteBuf` conversions

timeline.message:
Make `HttpData` closeable and support more `ByteBuf` conversions

Motivation:

- It is currently inconvenient to deal with the life cycle of pooled
  `HttData`. A user has to manually release the underlying `ByteBuf`
  after downcasting to `ByteBufHolder`.
- The ways to convert an `HttpData` to a `ByteBuf` is quite limited.
  A user has to write various boilerplate code to compensate this.
- A user can modify the `{reader,writer}Index` of the returned
  `ByteBuf`, which will cause many unexpected behaviors.
  - Even Netty's default HTTP/2 flow controller modifies it, so we need
    some protection mechanism.

Modifications:

- `HttpData` now extends `SafeCloseable`.
- `ByteBufHttpData` does not implement `ByteHolder` anymore. Instead,
  `HttpData` provides well defined conversion methods named `byteBuf()`
  that cover most use cases.
- Added `ByteBufAccessMode` to support various conversion mode.
- Renamed `DefaultHttpData` to `ByteArrayHttpData`.
- Removed `ByteRangeHttpData` in favor of `ByteBufHttpData`.
  - It was only used in test cases anyway.
- Moved `PooledObjects` to the `unsafe` package and made it public.
  - Moved the documentation about pooled `HttpData` there.
- Added `@UnstableApi` to all classes and methods related with pooled
  objects.

Result:

- Less confusing contract of `HttpData`-to-`ByteBuf` conversion
- Easier life cycle management of pooled `HttpData`.
- Fixes #1936

replies.bodyText: It makes or does not make a copy depending on situation,  so 'retained' or 'duplicate' is not always correct. DIRECT_COPY_OR_RETAINED_DUPLICATE is too long obviously. Any better suggestions?
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText:
I think semantically it's the same as RETAINED_DUPLICATE, returning a new reference but guarantees that it's direct, so seems clear. The copy is sort of an implementation detail that is fine with javadoc.
Otherwise direct seems like a totally different concept from the others and looks weird in this enum.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: 'duplicate' and 'retained duplicate' in Netty are well-known terms that signify they will never make a copy, so I still think it's confusing to use here. 🤔
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: FOR_IO seems a bit better yeah
